value.title: Unity moves robotics design and training to the metaverse
value.excerpt: Unity launched Unity Simulation Pro and Unity SystemGraph to improve robotics modeling, testing, and training complex systems through AI.

value.title: 'Hotspotting the Opioid Crisis': Here's how artificial intelligence will identify those at-risk for an overdose
value.excerpt: Using artificial intelligence, the SI PPS and the MIT Sloan School of Management developed a predictive analytic program that will pull data from more than 70 providers and partners on Staten Island to identify who is at highest risk of an overdose.

value.title: Regulators looking into complaint about Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' software
value.excerpt: U.S. auto safety regulators are looking into a complaint from a Tesla driver that the company’s “Full Self-Driving” software caused a crash.

value.title: Report: 95% of execs say hiring professionals trained in AI is difficult
value.excerpt: As leaders consider hiring new AI talent, they shouldn't overlook the importance of training to help mitigate bias and encourage ethical AI.

value.title: Is Scotland A Major Contender In The AI Space?
value.excerpt: Governments and countries are taking advantage of the tremendous transformation presented by AI to position themselves for global competitiveness. Scotland is one such country doing this. Are they now becoming a major contender in the AI space?

value.title: Robots vs. Fatbergs: High-Tech Approaches to America’s Sewer Problem
value.excerpt: Cash-strapped U.S. cities are turning to drones, artificial intelligence and other innovations to help inspect and fix the country’s aging, underground arteries of waste

value.title: AI tool offers cure for scattered medical data
value.excerpt: Aggregating medical data for patients and analyzing it using AI algorithms can yield useful insights for hospitals and health care systems.

value.title: Facebook, bad news and business ethics: Consider the consequences of every decision
value.excerpt: Facebook's recent challenges should serve as a lesson to all leaders to identify and mitigate ethical concerns before they escalate.

value.title: AI Weekly: Workplace surveillance algorithms need to be regulated before it’s too late
value.excerpt: A growing number of companies are using potentially flawed, invasive workplace monitoring algorithms -- with little oversight.

value.title: How Element 451’s Focus On Bias In Education Teaches The Rest Of Us About Disability And Bias In AI
value.excerpt: For all the myriad benefits, one of the problems with AI is bias—it’s fair to question whether the data these systems are given is favoring (or not) certain types of people more than others.

value.title: Software platform speeds deployment of large language models
value.excerpt: NVIDIA opened the door for enterprises worldwide to develop and deploy large language models (LLM) by enabling them to build their own domain-specific chatbots, personal assistants, and other AI applications that understand language with unprecedented levels of subtlety and nuance.

value.title: How AI fights fraud in the telecom industry
value.excerpt: Americans lost $29.8 billion in phone fraud over the past year. Can AI fraud detection change this? In 2021, over 59 million Americans said they lost money as a result of phone scams, with an average reported loss of $502.

value.title: AWS and NVIDIA launch “Hands-on Machine Learning with Amazon SageMaker and NVIDIA GPUs” on Coursera
value.excerpt: AWS and NVIDIA are excited to announce the new Hands-on Machine Learning with Amazon SageMaker and NVIDIA GPUs course. The course has four parts, and is designed to help machine learning (ML) enthusiasts quickly learn how to perform modern ML in the AWS Cloud. Sign up for the course today on Coursera.

value.title: When Doctors Become Too Reliant on Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Human error can confound algorithms.

value.title: The ethics of digital technology in the food sector
value.excerpt: Imagine a world in which smart packaging for supermarket-ready meals updates you in real-time to tell you about carbon footprints, gives live warnings on product recalls and instant safety alerts because allergens were detected unexpectedly in the factory.

value.title: Stori Raises $200 Million for Financial Services for the Underserved
value.excerpt: Mexico-based Stori landed $200 million this week in combined debt and equity. The investment, which bring the company’s total funding to almost $250 million, will help the fintech provide financial services to its region’s underserved customers.
